t: Jeremiah 2
Judah’s Apostasy
Now*p the word of the Lord*s came to me saying,

“Go and proclaim in the ears of Jerusalem, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord,*s “I*pn remember concerning you the devotion of your youth, The*ln love of your betrothals, Your*ln following after Me in the wilderness, Through*ln a land not sown.
Israel*ln was holy to the Lord,*s The*ln first of His harvest. All*ln who ate of it became guilty; Evil*ln came upon them,” declares the Lord*s .’ ”
Hear*p the word of the Lord,*s O house of Jacob, and all the families of the house of Israel.
Thus says the Lord,*s “What*pn injustice did your fathers find in Me, That*ln they went far from Me And*ln walked after emptiness and became empty?

They*ln did not say, ‘Where is the Lord*s Who*ln brought us up out of the land of Egypt, Who*ln led us through the wilderness, Through*ln a land of deserts and of pits, Through*ln a land of drought and of deep darkness, Through*ln a land that no one crossed And*ln where no man dwelt?’
I*ln brought you into the fruitful land To*ln eat its fruit and its good things. But*ln you came and defiled My land, And*ln My inheritance you made an abomination.

The*ln priests did not say, ‘Where is the Lord?’*s And*ln those who handle the law did not know Me; The*ln rulers also transgressed against Me, And*ln the prophets prophesied by Baal And*ln walked after things that did not profit.
“Therefore*ln I will yet contend with you,” declares the Lord,*s “And*ln with your sons’ sons I will contend.
For*ln cross to the coastlands of Kittim and see, And*ln send to Kedar and observe closely And*ln see if there has been such a*i thing*i as this!
Has*ln a nation changed gods When*ln they were not gods? But*ln My people have changed their glory For*ln that which does not profit.
Be*ln appalled, O heavens, at this, And*ln shudder, be very desolate,” declares the Lord.*s
“For*ln My people have committed two evils: They*ln have forsaken Me, The*ln fountain of living waters, To*ln hew for themselves cisterns, Broken*ln cisterns That*ln can hold no water.
“Is*ln Israel a slave? Or is he a homeborn servant? Why*ln has he become a prey?
The*ln young lions have roared at him, They*ln have roared loudly. And*ln they have made his land a waste; His*ln cities have been destroyed, without inhabitant.
Also*ln the men of Memphis and Tahpanhes Have*ln shaved the crown of your head.
Have*ln you not done this to yourself By*ln your forsaking the Lord*s your God When*ln He led you in the way?
But*ln now what are you doing on the road to Egypt, To*ln drink the waters of the Nile? Or*ln what are you doing on the road to Assyria, To*ln drink the waters of the Euphrates?

Your*ln own wickedness will correct you, And*ln your apostasies will reprove you; Know*ln therefore and see that it is evil and bitter For*ln you to forsake the Lord*s your God, And*ln the dread of Me is not in you,” declares the Lord God*s of hosts.
“For*ln long ago I broke your yoke And*iln tore off your bonds; But*ln you said, ‘I will not serve!’ For*ln on every high hill And*ln under every green tree You*ln have lain down as a harlot.
Yet*ln I planted you a choice vine, A*ln completely faithful seed. How*ln then have you turned yourself before Me Into*ln the degenerate shoots of a foreign vine?
Although*ln you wash yourself with lye And*ln use much soap, The*ln stain of your iniquity is before Me,” declares the Lord God.*s
“How*ln can you say, ‘I am not defiled, I*ln have not gone after the Baals’? Look*ln at your way in the valley! Know*ln what you have done! You*ln are a swift young camel entangling her ways,

A*ln wild donkey accustomed to the wilderness, That*ln sniffs the wind in her passion. In*ln the*i time*i of*i her heat who can turn her away? All*ln who seek her will not become weary; In*ln her month they will find her.
Keep*ln your feet from being unshod And*ln your throat from thirst; But*ln you said, ‘It is hopeless! No!*ln For I have loved strangers, And*ln after them I will walk.’
“As*ln the thief is shamed when he is discovered, So*ln the house of Israel is shamed; They,*ln their kings, their princes And*ln their priests and their prophets,

Who*ln say to a tree, ‘You are my father,’ And*ln to a stone, ‘You gave me birth.’ For*ln they have turned their*i back to Me, And*ln not their*i face; But*ln in the time of their trouble they will say, ‘Arise*ln and save us.’

But*ln where are your gods Which*ln you made for yourself? Let*ln them arise, if they can save you In*ln the time of your trouble; For*ln according*i to*i the number of your cities Are*ln your gods, O Judah.
“Why*ln do you contend with Me? You*ln have all transgressed against Me,” declares the Lord.*s
“In*ln vain I have struck your sons; They*ln accepted no chastening. Your*ln sword has devoured your prophets Like*ln a destroying lion.

O*ln generation, heed the word of the Lord.*s Have*ln I been a wilderness to Israel, Or*ln a land of thick darkness? Why*ln do My people say, ‘We are*i free*i to*i roam; We*ln will no longer come to You’?
Can*ln a virgin forget her ornaments, Or*ln a bride her attire? Yet*ln My people have forgotten Me Days*ln without number.
How*ln well you prepare your way To*ln seek love! Therefore*ln even the wicked women You*ln have taught your ways.
Also*ln on your skirts is found The*ln lifeblood of the innocent poor; You*ln did not find them breaking in. But*ln in spite of all these things,
Yet*ln you said, ‘I am innocent; Surely*ln His anger is turned away from me.’ Behold,*ln I will enter into judgment with you Because*ln you say, ‘I have not sinned.’
Why*ln do you go around so much Changing*ln your way? Also,*ln you will be put to shame by Egypt As*ln you were put to shame by Assyria.
From*ln this place*i also you will go out With*ln your hands on your head; For*ln the Lord*s has rejected those in whom you trust, And*ln you will not prosper with them.”
